total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the unique colors in the grid.
Q2: For each color, identify the top left corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q3: For each color, identify the bottom right corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q4: For each color, create a new grid that only contains the cells within the rectangle identified in Q2 and Q3.
Q5: Arrange the new grids from Q4 in ascending order of the color.
Q1: Identify the unique colors in the grid.
Q2: For each color, identify the top left corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q3: For each color, identify the bottom right corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q4: For each color, create a new grid that only contains the cells within the rectangle identified in Q2 and Q3.

Q5: Arrange the new grids from Q4 in ascending order of the y-coordinate of the top left corner identified in Q2. If two or more grids have the same y-coordinate, arrange them in ascending order of the x-coordinate.
Q6: Combine the arranged grids from Q5 into one grid by placing them one below the other.
Q1: Identify the unique colors in the grid.
Q2: For each color, identify the top left corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q3: For each color, identify the bottom right corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q4: For each color, create a new grid that only contains the cells within the rectangle identified in Q2 and Q3.
Q5: Arrange the new grids from Q4 in the order of the colors identified in Q1, from top to bottom.
select_new_ys: Q1: Identify the unique colors in the grid.
Q2: For each color, identify the top left corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q3: For each color, identify the bottom right corner of the smallest rectangle that can contain all cells of that color.
Q4: For each color, create a new grid that only contains the cells within the rectangle identified in Q2 and Q3.

Q5: Arrange the new grids from Q4 in ascending order of the y-coordinate of the top left corner identified in Q2. If two or more grids have the same y-coordinate, arrange them in ascending order of the x-coordinate.
Q6: Combine the arranged grids from Q5 into one grid by placing them one below the other.
